title: [Self-Directed] Modular Practical Programming Education Based on High-Performance Computing (HPC)

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational C/C++ programming skills and understanding of parallel processing concepts
context.additional_context: A course focusing on parallel computing practice utilizing GPUs in a BYOD environment, including case studies on social field data processing

learning_goals: Three or more GPU-accelerated codes can be implemented using the OpenACC/OpenMP offloading model.
The ability to optimize CPU-GPU heterogeneous systems through the HIP programming model is cultivated.

Learners can select one topic (population analysis or climate modeling) within a 4-week course, design a data processing project using HPC technology, submit a 10-page analysis report deriving five or more core indicators (e.g., population density change rate, carbon emission predictions), and achieve an average score of 3.5 or higher (out of 5) on the report rubric (clarity of topic, data processing accuracy, indicator validity, logical conclusion, format compliance).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
